titleStmt.title: George W. Anderson vs. John H. McGraw. Writ of Habeas Corpus

bibl.title: George W. Anderson vs. John H. McGraw. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
IN THE DISTRICT COURT,
Of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Seattle, for the County of King. HABEAS CORPUS

The People of the United States of America, to the Sheriff of King COunty Greeting: We command you, that you have the body of George W. Anderson Committed by the name of Service by you imprisoned and detained as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name said Geo W. Anderson shall be called or charged, before the HON. Richard A. Jones C H Hanford Judge of the aforesaid Court at Seattle forthwith to do and receive what shall then adn there be considered concrening him the said Geo. W. Anderson ANd have you then and there this writ.
Witness the Hon. Richard A. Jones C H Hanford Judge of the said District Court, and the seal thereof this 1st day of October A. D. 1889. R M Hopkins Clerk. By Deputy Clerk

Sheriffs Office, Seattle, Oct. 1, 1889. I, J. H. McGraw, Sheriff of King County, W. T. do herby certify that I recieved the within writ of Habeas Corpus on the 1st day of October 1889, and in obedience thereto I now on this day produce the within petitiones in open Court, I further certify that he was delievered into my custody by J. C. Mitchell, Chief of Police of the City of Seattle, W. T. in said County who held him under a teleghaphic direction from S. B Parish Chief of Police of the City of Portland, in the State of Oregon directing the arrest of the said petitioner upon a warrant in his hands charging the said petitioner with obtaining money under false pretences; and I further certify that according to the teleghaphic description of the person charge with said crime in said warrant the petitioner is one and the same.
J. H. McGraw, Sheriff of King County, W. T. By R. M. Hanford Deputy.

No 7261 In the District Court, Third Judicial District, Holding Terms at Seattle, W. T.
In the Matter of the Application of Geo. W. Anderson For Writ of Habeas Corpus. HABEAS CORPUS. Discharged Returned and filed this 1st day of Oct A. D. 1889 R. M. Hopkins Clerk. By Deputy Clerk.
